Hi Gordon, 

Sorry for answering jus=
t now. Last week was so busy. 

I was looking for a stray character on all =
of the override segments
and I didn't find any. The filters are correct bec=
ause when I try to
crawl a domain, I create a simple job (without overrides=
) and the
filters do work. When I create a job with more than one domain, a=
nd
create a override for each domain, the same filters (from the simple
job=
) are applied on the specific override. In this case they (filters)
don't w=
ork.

I'm actually using Host scope, and these filters are created as a
Exc=
lude-Filter. The URI's that I want to accept, are expressed as a
regular ex=
pression and the return value is FALSE. The URI's that I
don't want to acce=
pt are also expressed as a regular expression but
the return value is TRUE.=


Once more, thanks you in advance.
